answers.answer: I had high blood pressure before I got pregnant.  Mine went down after I got pregnant.  Dr.  Told me that as little stress possible,  and taking walks to help keep it down.  Try walking maybe? Or find a healthy way to relieve stress?

I seriously recommend that you have your doctor keep track of your bp. You're at a high risk for preeclampsia. I had to be put on meds and im doing so much better. But if you have headaches that you cant get rid of or you get dizzy or see spots, get help!

I had high blood pressure with my first pregnancy and haven't had a problem with my second. This is what im doing..... im taking flaxseed oil 1 Tablespoon once a day. I take a shot of  cayenne oil and chase it with chocolate once a day.  I buy it from my local health food store and follow the instructions on the bottle. I get my heart rate up once a day by fast walking for half an hour and ive noticed the worst food for me is Potatoe chips.  Invest in home blood pressure kit too that way you can monitor the effects of the food  you eat and good luck.

question: I have pretty high blood pressure. Wanting to know if anyone has advice on how to help lower it.  I haven't been adding salt to things or drinking coffee. And it has gone up since I've been pregnant
title: high blood pressure
